title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine whether the value $$y= rac{3}{5}$$ is a solution to the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$, we can substitute $$ rac{3}{5}$$ for $$y$$ in the equation and see if it results in a true statement.
Substituting $$ rac{3}{5}$$ for $$y$$ in the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$ gives us:
$$5\left( rac{3}{5}ight)+3=\operatorname{10}\left( rac{3}{5}ight)-4$$
This simplifies to:
$$3+3=6-4$$
Which simplifies to:
$$6=2$$
This is $$n$$
